pullRequest.title: feat: Reviving of "UI for editing arbitrary types and AutoConfigs"
pullRequest.bodyText:
Contains
TypeWidgetLibrary: A system to generate a UIWidget bound to an object/Binding of any arbitrary type.
NUI support for FlexibleConfig (will potentially be repurposed to support AutoConfigs introduced in #3723)
Updated, Merged with develop and splitted in TeraNUI too.
TeraNUI's PR: MovingBlocks/TeraNUI#36
Should work together.
How to test(currently test screens)

open game
go to "settings"
3.a. check autoconfig screen
3.b. check builtin screen ( type command showScreen builtinTypeWidgetTestScreen)
3.c. check math screen  ( type command showScreen mathTypeWidgetTestScreen)

Outstanding

 Autoconfig translate
 Autoconfig's widgets buildings via TypeWidgetLibrary
 Autoconfig's ui documentation.
 Remove test screens (using for demonstration purpose)
 replace AudioSettingScreen with AutoConfigScreen (AudioConfig already uses AutoConfig)

Follow-up (don't see there while don't merged)

Split AutoConfigs at loading scopes (add feature):

GLOBAL - configs for entire game(all stages/subsystems, etc). Provides by subsystems, engine itself.
GAME - configs for entire game, with all worlds. Provides by subsystems, engine, modules.
WORLD - configs for world.  Provides by subsystems, engine, modules. (ideally for world generator's configs)




GAME and WORLD configs should transfer via network in multiplayer(if needs)



Split AutoConfig's Settings by "user roles"(codename):

usual player - can be changed in Settings menu
advanced player - can be changed in Settings -> Advanced Settings menu
internal/no gui - cannot be changed by GUI (needs or special mechanic, or code only usage)



Try integrate TypeWidgetLibrary in some exists screens.


Link to previous PR:
close #3699
Copy from #3699 :
This PR has two major contents:
TypeWidgetLibrary: A system to generate a UIWidget bound to an object/Binding of any arbitrary type.
NUI support for FlexibleConfig (will potentially be repurposed to support AutoConfigs introduced in #3723)

Arbitrary Type Widgets
Used to generate UIWidgets to edit any arbitrary type. Follows a system of generating widgets through TypeWidgetFactorys stored in a TypeWidgetLibrary, very similar to the TypeHandlerLibrary-TypeHandlerFactory system introduced in #3535.
You can test the widgets in the builtinTypeWidgetTestScreen (widgets for types like collections, arrays, numbers, strings, arbitrary objects) and the mathTypeWidgetTestScreen (TeraMath types like vectors, rects, and quaternions).
TypeWidgetLibrary
Contains a number of TypeWidgetFactorys which are queried to create UIWidgets. The UIWidget for an object is obtained by querying each TypeWidgetFactory until one makes a UIWidget successfully.
TypeWidgetFactory
Creates UIWidgets for objects of a specific structure/type.
TODO
Documentation

Nice-to-haves
Support recursive types by separating widget creation and binding process and caching created widgets
    Dependency: Introduce widget cloning to clone cached widgets (maybe serialize-deserialize via #3535?)

FlexibleConfig/AutoConfig UI
Introduces a prototype for how UI for FlexibleConfigs will work. This PR will ultimately contain a fully working NUI frontend for FlexibleConfigs.
Workflow
TODO: Obsolete, needs to be updated
The main components of the FC NUI frontend are FlexibleConfigWidgetFactory, SettingWidgetFactory, and SettingWidget. For a usage example, please look at FlexibleConfigTestScreen. The screen can be loaded in the menus using showScreen flexibleConfigTest; it need not be loaded in-game.
FlexibleConfigWidgetFactory
The FlexibleConfigWidgetFactory is used to build widgets that render entire FCs, i.e. render all their settings. Since settings will never be used in isolation, all a caller has to do to render UI for a FlexibleConfig is call the FlexibleConfigWidgetFactory.buildWidgetFor(FlexibleConfig) method, which returns a UIWidget that can be used anywhere.
The FlexibleConfigWidgetFactory requires a ModuleManager and an AssetManager -- the former for getting the ModuleEnvironment to load SettingWidgets from, and the latter to load widgets stored in a .ui asset.
buildWidgetFor
the buildWidgetFor method builds a PropertyLayout with its settings as properties. The widget generation for a specific setting is delegated to SettingWidgetFactory.
SettingWidgetFactory
SettingWidgetFactory is responsible for creating, via reflection, a SettingWidget bound to a specific Setting. Since the constraint on a setting is truly what determines how its UI must be rendered (i.e. what options to give the user), it uses the type of SettingConstraint on the setting to load the corresponding SettingWidget. Since settings will never be used in isolation, this class will never have to be used elsewhere and can (should) safely be made package-private.
SettingWidget
The primary responsibility to render UI for a Setting falls onto the SettingWidget. It is an abstract class generic over the type of value and constraint of the setting it is bound to. Much like screens, the template for a SettingWidget can specified in a .ui file, whose URI must be specified in the SettingWidget constructor.
initialise
The widget specified in the .ui file is loaded (via loadContents) and the SettingWidget is bound to a Setting (retrievable via getSetting) before the abstract method initialise is called. The initialise method is meant to allow subclasses to add listeners and Bindings to UI widgets to set the value in the setting. This method is implemented much like CoreScreenLayer.initialise; widgets can be found using the find method and can be set up to modify the value in the bound Setting.
TODO
Documentation
Support no (null) constraint via TypeWidgetLibrary
Translation support for FlexibleConfig and Setting names and descriptions
Package protect internal classes (like SettingWidgetFactory)

commit.message:
Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/develop' into feature/flexibleconfig-ui

# Conflicts:
#	engine/src/main/java/org/terasology/engine/module/ModuleManager.java
#	engine/src/main/java/org/terasology/engine/module/ModuleManagerImpl.java
fix(flexable-config): fix  LGTM issue: variable usage after check `variable == null`
Generify SettingWidget over type of value stored in Setting
Complete NumberRangeSettingWidget, Use PropertyLayout in FC widgets
Use Constraint UIWidget factory over storing widget in SettingWidget
Use Canvas restricted size to get content width in RowLayout
Add Array construction support to ConstructorLibrary
Add ArrayWidgetFactory, ReflectionUtil element type helpers
Add ModuleTypeWidgetLibraryWrapper, Move ModuleContext to engine.module
Create TypeWidgetLibrary wrappers that set ModuleContext
Expand individual elements in Collection widget
Filter nulls on update immutable collection in CollectionWidgetFactory
Prevent relayouting on add/remove in GrowableListWidgetFactory
Fix no-arg constructor creation bug in ObjectLayoutBuilder
Filter allowed types by providing module in ObjectLayoutBuilder
Do not handle Object type in ObjectWidgetFactory
Add primitive and final field support in ObjectLayoutBuilder
Use Binding.makeChildBinding in object, array and collection widgets
Make GrowableList widget element removal independent of index
Split TypeWidgetLibrary into interface and implementation
Add @RegisterTypeWidgetFactory, Move default factories to registry
Add VectorXY and Quat4f widget factories
Add Rect2f and Rect2i widget factories
Do not update parent binding when creating element binding
Use SubtypeLayoutBuilder in ObjectLayoutBuilder and FieldsWidgetBuilder
Use base widget if it is a custom widget in SubtypeLayoutBuilder
Use getBaseTypeWidget for elements in GrowableListWidgetBuilder
Clarify reasons for unreachable catch blocks in FieldsWidgetBuilder
fix(flexibleconfig-ui): fix usage same assets and widget from it on all settings with one type.
doc(flexibleconfig-ui): Make AutoConfig as part of TypeWidgetLibrary

Revert "fix(flexibleconfig-ui): translate for AutoConfig"

This reverts commit d7f1c52a

Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/develop' into feature/flexibleconfig-ui

# Conflicts:
#	engine/src/main/java/org/terasology/config/AudioConfig.java
#	engine/src/main/java/org/terasology/engine/module/ModuleManagerImpl.java
#	engine/src/main/java/org/terasology/rendering/nui/asset/UIFormat.java
#	engine/src/main/java/org/terasology/rendering/nui/internal/NUIManagerInternal.java
#	subsystems/TypeHandlerLibrary/src/test/java/org/terasology/persistence/typeHandling/coreTypes/CollectionTypeHandlerTest.java

nodes.bodyText: Using a method to obtain the name of the config is okay for now, but I would like to see a cleaner (more automagic) approach to this. Maybe some sort of mechanism in AutoConfigManager that automatically retrieves the (translatable) name from some common place, or an annotation on the config class? At the very least, I'd recommend making this method non-abstract and returning the simple name of the config class as the default. We should discuss this in a follow-up AutoConfig issue after the PR is merged, ideally after we have a better idea of its scope and usage.

Creates {@link UISlider} for settings of {@link Number} types with constraint {@link NumberRangeConstraint}
We can then simplify the type param description to be The type of {@link Number} or something to that effect.
What's the rationale behind the creation of a new context here?

Do we want to put this here, visible in the settings menu where players may also access it? I'd rather just instantiate and view these test screens via the console command (and not have them be accessible via the UI).

Let's not do this here; let's instead use the annotation and inject the ModuleManager and AssetManager dependencies via @In or create and add the AutoConfigWidgetFactory to the registry in the initialization phase of AutoConfigManager. This will make life easier when we move the type widget library into TeraNUI and extract AutoConfig into its own separate repository. For proper modularity, I would prefer the annotation and injection approach, so that we can separate AutoConfig from the AutoConfig UI implementation as well (if we need to for DestSol, for example).
As above; I don't think we should make these test screens visible in the main game UI. If we need to view them, we can always use the console command to load them.

commit.message: feat(twl): fix javadoc for NumberRangeConstraintWidgetFactory and remove test screens.

Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/develop' into feature/flexibleconfig-ui

# Conflicts:
#	engine-tests/src/test/java/org/terasology/persistence/serializers/TypeSerializerTest.java
#	engine-tests/src/test/java/org/terasology/persistence/serializers/VectorTypeSerializerTest.java
#	engine/src/main/java/org/terasology/rendering/nui/editor/utils/NUIEditorNodeUtils.java
#	engine/src/main/java/org/terasology/rendering/nui/skin/UISkinFormat.java

nodes.bodyText: In that case, let's move this to AutoConfigManager or even ConfigurationSubsystem.initialise() at least. It definitely shouldn't be here, since (as the method name suggests) we only want to add widget factories of builtin types here.

Are we still keeping this here? If yes, we must make sure to remove this before the next release. I would still prefer getting rid of this button entirely and using the showScreen engine:autoConfigTestScreen command to load this screen whenever needed for testing. That's the approach I used to load the type widget factory test screens as well.

commit.message: refactor(flexable-config): Make autoconfig screen production ready.

nodes.bodyText: This should get a "Back" button at some point 😉
It should be driven by how translations are managed currently from the engine. just retrieving the base name seems fine in the cases. seems simple enough without adding additional complexity.
I forget but I think there is a major performance problem with the subtype scanner stuff from reflection. kind of unavoidable I would guess.
